newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine July trade deficit $15 mln.
newsitem.headline: Argentine July trade deficit $15 mln.

text.p: Argentina ran up a trade deficit of $15 million in July, compared with a surplus of $323 million in July 1995 and a surplus of $203 million in June this year, the Economy Ministry said Wednesday.
In July exports were $2.24 billion, 21 percent more than in July 1995. Imports were $2.25 billion, up 48 percent from the same month last year.
Exports in June this year were $2.18 billion and imports were $1.98 billion.
Argentina accumulated a $576-million trade surplus during the first seven months of the year, compared with a $1.16 billion surplus in the same period of 1995.

Exports in the first seven months totalled $13.5 billion, compared with $12.7 billion in the same period last year. Imports in the period totalled $12.93 billion, versus $11.54 billion in the first seven months of 1995.
